choices.B: The user has to supply the time zone with each data point
choices.A: The user can get the aggregate data of the numbers generated over a minute and send it to CloudWatch
choices.C: CloudWatch will not truncate the number until it has an exponent larger than 126 (i.e. (1 x 10^126))
choices.D: The user can create a file in the JSON format with the metric name and value and supply it to CloudWatch

questions.question_text: A user has setup a custom application which generates a number in decimals. The user wants to track that number and setup the alarm whenever the number is above a certain limit. The application is sending the data to CloudWatch at regular intervals for this purpose. Which of the below mentioned statements is not true with respect to the above scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In CloudWatch, the time zone is not required to be supplied with each data point. CloudWatch uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for all timestamps. When sending data to CloudWatch, the timestamps are automatically recorded in UTC. Therefore, the user does not need to supply the time zone explicitly.
B. The user has to supply the time zone with each data point
If you are not supplying TZ then, it will take the current UTC time at the time of receiving.

questions.answer_description: When the EC2 instance is launched from an instance store backed AMI, it will not allow the user to configure the shutdown behavior to ג€Stopג€. It gives a warning that the instance does not have the EBS root volume.

choices.A: It will not allow the user to shutdown the OS when the shutdown behavior is set to Stop
choices.B: It is not possible to set the termination behavior to Stop for an Instance store backed AMI instance
choices.C: The instance will stay running but the OS will be shutdown

questions.question_text: A user has launched an EC2 Windows instance from an instance store backed AMI. The user has also set the Instance initiated shutdown behavior to stop. What will happen when the user shuts down the OS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When an EC2 instance is launched from an instance store-backed AMI, the instance initiated shutdown behavior cannot be set to "stop." The instance store-backed AMIs do not support the stop behavior, which means that when the user shuts down the operating system, the instance will be terminated automatically.
B. It is not possible to set the termination behavior to Stop for an Instance store backed AMI instance

questions.question_text:
A user has enabled versioning on an S3 bucket. The user is using server side encryption for data at Rest. If the user is supplying his own keys for encryption
(SSE-C., which of the below mentioned statements is true?
questions.answer_description: AWS S3 supports client side or server side encryption to encrypt all data at rest. The server side encryption can either have the S3 supplied AES-256 encryption key or the user can send the key along with each API call to supply his own encryption key (SSE-C). If the bucket is versioning-enabled, each object version uploaded by the user using the SSE-C feature can have its own encryption key. The user is responsible for tracking which encryption key was used for which object's version

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/ServerSideEncryptionCustomerKeys.html

SS-C : If your bucket is versioning-enabled, each object version you upload using this feature can have its own encryption key. You are responsible for tracking which encryption key was used for which object version.
B. It is possible to have different encryption keys for different versions of the same object

choices.C: AWS S3 does not allow the user to upload his own keys for server side encryption
choices.B: It is possible to have different encryption keys for different versions of the same object
choices.D: The SSE-C does not work when versioning is enabled
choices.A: The user should use the same encryption key for all versions of the same object
The VPC will modify the first subnet CIDR automatically to allow the second subnet IP range
choices.C: The second subnet will be created
choices.B: It is not possible to create a subnet with the same CIDR as VPC
choices.D: It will throw a CIDR overlaps error

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Since the CIDR range of the new subnet (20.0.0.1/24) overlaps with the CIDR range of the existing subnet (20.0.0.0/16), it is not possible to create the second subnet without resolving the CIDR conflict. The user will need to choose a non-overlapping CIDR range for the new subnet in order to create it successfully.
D. It will throw a CIDR overlaps error

questions.question_text: A user has created a VPC with CIDR 20.0.0.0/16. The user has created one subnet with CIDR 20.0.0.0/16 in this VPC. The user is trying to create another subnet with the same VPC for CIDR 20.0.0.1/24. What will happen in this scenario?
questions.answer_description: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to the user's AWS account. A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside that subnet. The user can create a subnet with the same size of VPC. However, he cannot create any other subnet since the CIDR of the second subnet will conflict with the first subnet.

questions.question_text:
A user has launched an RDS MySQL DB with the Multi AZ feature. The user has scheduled the scaling of instance storage during maintenance window. What is the correct order of events during maintenance window?
1. Perform maintenance on standby
2. Promote standby to primary
3. Perform maintenance on original primary
4. Promote original master back as primary

discussion.content: Once standby promoted to Primary then, Primary will become a standby. Hence step 4 is not in place.

questions.answer_description:
Running MySQL on the RDS DB instance as a Multi-AZ deployment can help the user reduce the impact of a maintenance event, as the Amazon will conduct maintenance by following the steps in the below mentioned order:

Perform maintenance on standby -

Promote standby to primary -
Perform maintenance on original primary, which becomes the new standby.
